meanings.definition: To set an incorrect price for something.
meanings.sent1: The store accidentally mispriced the new video game.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to misprice items when labeling them for sale.
meanings.sent3: The mispriced bananas were so cheap that everyone bought them in a hurry.
meanings.sent4: She mispriced her talent, thinking she was not good enough for the role.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of mispricing can lead to financial losses for the business.

meanings.definition: An incorrect price set for something.
meanings.sent1: The misprice on the menu caused confusion among the customers.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the misprice on the ticket and informed the staff.
meanings.sent3: Finding a misprice in the store felt like discovering a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: The misprice in the auction made the painting sell for much less than its value.
meanings.sent5: The misprice was quickly corrected to avoid any misunderstandings.
